title: Cheeky squirrels hid more than 200 walnuts under hood of couple's SUV
text:
Chris Persic was shocked to find hundreds of walnuts in his car. (Picture: ABC News)

A couple was astonished to find grass and more than 200 walnuts stored under the hood of their SUV by squirrels preparing for winter.

In fact, Chris Persic, who owns the car, said the squirrels appeared to have stored enough to last them the next three winters.

Chris Persic, of Pittsburgh, Pennsylvania, told KDKA that his wife Holly called him while she was at the Northland Library complaining that the car smelled like it was burning and making strange sounds.

‘I told her to pop the hood, and this is the picture she sent me,’ Persic said. He told ABC ‘She sent that text and my jaw hit the floor.’

The shocking photo shows the SUV’s engine compartment so full of debris that the actual components of the car are not even visible.

Persic said he met his wife at the library and began picking walnuts out of the car – unfortunately, in the pouring rain.

He said: ‘It took about at least 45 minutes. There was a lot. I was soaking wet… but i could still see a good amount of walnuts underneath the motor.’

After removing as much as much of the grass and walnuts as they could, the couple drove the car to a nearby mechanic.

‘They put it up on the life and, I guess there’s a protective plate underneath, so when they took that off all the walnuts fell out all over the place,’ Persic said.

By the time the mechanic was done, half of a trash can was filled with walnuts.

Luckily for the Persics, the car did not have any serious damage.

Chris Persic later posted to Facebook, writing: ‘Whether people are gonna admit it or not, I guarantee at least a couple of people have looked under their hood since seeing the post.’
